newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo Trucks says deliveries fell 7 pct Jan-April.
newsitem.headline: Volvo Trucks says deliveries fell 7 pct Jan-April.

text.p: Volvo Trucks, a unit of Swedish automotive group AB Volvo, said on Friday its deliveries fell to 21,047 in the first four months of the year from 22,585 in the corresponding year earlier period.
Volvo Truck spokesman Stefan Lorentzon said deliveries in Europe fell 14 percent to 11,068 units.
In North America they were down four percent to 6,394, in South America they were five percent lower at 1,791 vehicles and on other markets they fell five percent to 1,794.
"We have good and stable order intake in Europe where deliveries have increased in recent months," Lorentzon said, adding that Volvo's market share increased.
Order intake on the North American market was also stable.

Volvo launched its VN series in the United States in March but it will take unil next year before the effects are apparant, he said. Volvo then estimates it will deliver 4,000 or 5,000 vehicles, he said.
Interest has been keen, he said.
The pace of production has increased in Brazil. Volvo estimates it will deliver 18,000 vehicles there in 1997, which is 3,000 more than last year, he said.
